channel.title: MSDN: .NET Framework and CLR!
channel.description: The latest information for developers on the Microsoft .NET Framework and Common Language Runtime (CLR).

item.title: Extending the ASP.NET 2.0 Resource-Provider Models
item.description: ASP.NET 2.0 has unleashed a number of wonderful improvements for localizing Web applications. This article will help you apply extensibility features of ASP.NET to handle enterprise localization scenarios and improve your localization-development process.
item.dc:creator: Michèle Leroux Bustamante

item.title: How to Use Settings in Visual C# 2005
item.description: Learn the difference between application and user settings, how to create new settings at design time, how to access settings at runtime, and how to incorporate multiple sets of settings into your C# application.
item.dc:creator: Matt Stoecker

item.title: A Visual Basic Developer's Introduction to ASP.NET 2.0
item.description: Visual Basic .NET and Visual Basic 6.0 developers get an introduction to building Web applications with ASP.NET 2.0, as well as the major differences between developing desktop and Web applications.
item.dc:creator: Scott Swigart

item.title: The Digital Signing Framework of the Open Packaging Conventions
item.description: Discusses the OPC Digital Signing Framework, providing an overview of the package components and supporting services, and examples of signing policy and its implementation.
item.dc:creator: David Meltzer and Andrey Shur

item.title: Download the September CTP of the .NET Framework 3.0 Runtime Components
item.description: The latest release of the .NET Framework 3.0 Runtime Components is now available. This release supports Visual Studio 2005 and is compatible with 2007 Microsoft Office system Beta 2 Technical Refresh.

item.title: .NET Rocks! - Huihong Luo on Obfuscation and Decompiling
item.description: Dr. Huihong Luo discusses techniques of obfuscation and decompiling used in his Salamander Suite of tools.
item.dc:creator: Carl Franklin

item.title: How to Write a WIC-Enabled CODEC
item.description: This article describes the Windows Imaging Component (WIC), an extensible platform for digital imaging on Windows Vista. Any application using WIC can access, display, process, save, and print images using a single set of consistent interfaces.
item.dc:creator: Peggi Goodwin

item.title: See the Completely New Windows Vista Developer Center
item.description: Visit the redesigned Windows Vista Developer Center, which features a letter from Microsoft co-President Jim Allchin. Come see how to enhance your existing applications and build new ones that are more secure, connected, and visually stunning than ever.

item.title: Introducing Windows Presentation Foundation
item.description: Introduces Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) and describes its various features; clarifies the problems that WPF technology addresses, and then surveys the solutions that WPF provides.
item.dc:creator: David Chappell, Chappell & Associates

item.title: Behind the Scenes: Improvements to Windows Forms Data Binding in the .NET Framework 2.0, Part 2
item.description: Learn about the generic BindingList and how to extend this generic collection type to add sorting and searching functionality.
item.dc:creator: Cheryl Simmons

item.title: Introduction to the New Windows SDK
item.description: Melinda Jackson describes the combining of the Platform SDK, .NET Framework SDK, and WinFX SDKs, into the new Windows SDK. She also details the latest features that have been included and describes future enhancements.
item.dc:creator: Melinda Jackson

item.title: Service Station: What’s new in System.Xml 2.0?
item.description: In this installment of Service Station, Aaron Skonnard takes a long hard look at System.Xml 2.0.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Skonnard

item.title: Cutting Edge: Reporting task progress with ASP.NET 2.0
item.description: The progress bar is great for keeping users informed about the progress of a task. Unfortunately, there’s no progress bar element built into ASP.NET, so Dino Esposito solves that problem with his ProgressPanel control.
item.dc:creator: Dino Esposito

item.title: CLR Inside Out: Using concurrency for scalability
item.description: Because of the popularity of multiprocessor machines, many concurrency articles focus on how to make concurrency safe in your code. This article deals with how to get concurrency into your code in the first place.
item.dc:creator: Joe Duffy

item.title: Concurrent Affairs: Concurrency and Coordination Runtime
item.description: What can a robot-programming toolkit do for you? Read on and find out.
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Richter

item.title: Test Run: Randomness in testing
item.description: In this installment of Test Run, James McCaffrey discusses how you can generate and evaluate random test case data.
item.dc:creator: James McCaffrey

item.title: Advanced Basics: Predicates and actions
item.description: The System.Array and System.Collections.Generic.List classes provide methods that let you avoid writing code to loop through every element of an array or list to find the items you’re looking for. Ken Getz explains.
item.dc:creator: Ken Getz

item.title: .NET Matters: Scope<T> and more
item.description: This month Stephen Toub explains how you can get some of the functionality found in the TransactionScope class in your own classes.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Toub

item.title: Web Downloads: Build Smarter ASP.NET File Downloading Into Your Web Applications
item.description: In this article, Joe Stagner presents some solutions for downloading files from ASP.NET sites so your users will have a fast, secure, and error-free downloading experience.
item.dc:creator: Author(s):

item.title: Enterprise Library: Take Exception To Critical Errors With Custom Application Blocks
item.description: Enterprise Library is a collection of application functionality blocks that you can re-use in your application for common functionality you'd otherwise have to write again and again. Here Jay Hilyard explains how to use and extend them.
item.dc:creator: Jay Hilyard

item.title: Smart Clients: New Guidance And Tools For Building Integrated Desktop Applications
item.description: Integrated Desktop is a loosely coupled hosting architecture and composite UI that runs on the desktop and is supported by a loosely coupled architecture on the back end. It collapses the number of applications a user must deal with when making decisions.
item.dc:creator: Christian Thilmany and Jim Keane

item.title: .NET Rocks! - Miguel Castro on Web Controls 2.0
item.description: In this episode Miguel Castro talks about what's new in Web Controls in the .NET Framework 2.0.
item.dc:creator: Carl Franklin

item.title: .NET Rocks! - Jon Rauschenberger on Visual Basic 6.0 and Windows Forms Interop
item.description: Chicago Regional Director Jon Rauschenberger shares his secrets for converting Visual Basic 6.0 applications to .NET using a toolkit that he helped the Microsoft Visual Basic team develop.
item.dc:creator: Carl Franklin

item.title: Automatically Update Visual Basic 6 Applications with .NET and ClickOnce
item.description: See how to automatically update Visual Basic 6.0 applications and COM objects, using the .NET Framework 2.0 and ClickOnce deployment.
item.dc:creator: Scott Swigart

item.title: Flickr-ing about with .NET
item.description: Sam Judson shows you how simple, easy, and fun it is to integrate the Flickr API into your "Web 2.0" Web-based applications. This public API provides you with new and interesting ways to display and manipulate your photos.
item.dc:creator: Sam Judson
